item.title: Aerial_Knight’s Dropshot launches February 17 for PS5, Xbox Series, and PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

High-speed, stylized first-person shooter dated.

Aerial_Knight’s Dropshot, a fast-paced first-person shooter where five players must race against time to grab the only parachute to survive a fall from the sky, will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam on February 17, 2026, developer Aerial_Knight announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Aerial_Knight’s Dropshot is a fast-paced, heart-pounding first-person shooter where five characters. You and four Enemies are racing to grab the one parachute as you fall from the sky. Be the first to the ground alive. But with bullets flying, every second counts. Outfall your opponents, avoid enemy fire, and use your Finger Gun to take out Enemies

You’re armed with a limited number of Finger bullets. Finger blasting Enemies and clear your path to victory, Use the slipstreams from Enemies to gain speed, but they’ll try to take you down before you reach the ground.

Five fall but only one will land.

Key Features

  • Survive the Fall – Race against four other players to reach the ground first—and stay alive.
  • Limited Ammo – Start with only (X) bullets. Use them wisely to eliminate threats or protect yourself.
  • Slipstream Speed – Use your enemies’ slipstreams to gain speed, but they can do the same to you.
  • Quick Rounds – Each round lasts 30 to 45 seconds—fast-paced action that never lets up.
  • Dynamic Visuals – Stunning environments and thrilling perspectives as you plummet toward the earth.
  • Intense Soundtrack – Pulse-pounding music and sound effects with some style.

Live out your dream of finger-blasting multiple enemies as you all fall to your death.

Watch a new trailer below.

Release Date Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/01/aerial-knights-dropshot-launches-february-17-for-ps5-xbox-series-and-pc

item.title: Lovecraftian first-person adventure game HYPNOS announced for consoles, PC
item.content:encoded:
Redlock Studio has announced HYPNOS, a first-person adventure and exploration game set in a “Lovecraftian megastructure fever dream.” It will launch for unspecific consoles and PC via Steam in 2026.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

HYPNOS is a first-person adventure and exploration game, set in a Lovecraftian megastructure fever dream.

Enter the Nameless City at the edge of Dreams. Follow the trail into the shadow of the Holy Mountain. Wander through realms where the laws of the universe break down as they yield to other forces. Walk the Path and embrace your destiny.

Your story is being written in the pages of the Maze Chronicles.

“In the Dreamlands, all paths lead to the holy mountain of Kadath, where the gods dwell. Shadowed by the mountain is the Nameless City, built on the ruins of those who came before. There, Choron, a vagabond burdened by his past, searches for a faceless boy who haunts his dreams. To find the boy and unravel the threads of his own destiny, Choron must solve the city’s mysteries, face the Monarchs who rule the far reaches of the world and cross the veils that separate ignorance from truth.”

Find the faceless boy. Find Matthew.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Key Features

  • Exploration – Wander a unique semi-open world. Find your own way through the Nameless City.
  • Branched Dialogues, Choices and Alternative Endings – Meet the strange inhabitants of the Far Reaches. Dreamers, spirits, creatures and bizarre figures—they are all caught in the same web of causality. Your actions influence their destinies.
  • Layered World – Interact with your environment. Transform the materia of dreams and the City with it. Lift the veils that conceal reality.

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.

Announce Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/01/lovecraftian-first-person-adventure-game-hypnos-announced-for-consoles-pc
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Yuri visual novel Clover Reset coming to Switch
item.content:encoded:
Clover Reset first launched for PC via Steam on May 30, 2025. It supports English, Japanese, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese language options.

About

“99% sweetness × 1% surprise”!? A yuri novel game that you’ll fall in love with at first sight.

“Hey, do you know the meaning of the four-leaf clover?” Set at “Shonan Saika Academy,” a prestigious school in Shonan, Kanagawa Prefecture, this is a youthful story of girls wavering between friendship and love.

Synopsis

The wheels of fate begin to turn.

The girls meet, fall in love, and deepen their bonds.

“Hey, do you know the meaning of the four-leaf clover?”

Set at “Shonan Saika Academy,” a prestigious school in Shonan, Kanagawa Prefecture, this is a youthful story of girls wavering between friendship and love.

Shonan Saika Academy, a high-achieving all-girls school in Kanagawa Prefecture.

One day, Marin Tachibana, along with her best friends Mashiro Saotome and Kiyoka Jinguji, experiences a special day.

It begins with meeting an unusual new transfer student, Shizuku Kujyo.

A beautiful girl with a calm and dignified demeanor.

Meeting her feels like déjà vu…

While showing her around the school, they stop by an observation deck, where Marin finds a four-leaf clover.

There is a tradition at this school:

If you press a four-leaf clover found on the observation deck into your student notebook, your wish will come true.

(I want to get closer to her. To spend more time with her…)

With this wish, Marin gives Shizuku the “coincidental” four-leaf clover she found.

This act becomes a turning point, bringing Marin and Shizuku closer together with the help of Mashiro and Kiyoka. However…

“Please, stop worrying about me. I don’t want to just be protected…”

“Shizuku, we’re friends, right?”

A storm threatens to tear them apart.

It is deeply tied to a “secret” Shizuku is hiding and a “trauma” from Marin’s past.

The story follows the growth, mutual support, and cherished memories of the four girls.

Will Marin and the others find their personal “clover” (happiness)?

Characters

  • Marin Tachibana (voiced by Saho Shirasuna)
    • Catch: Gentle and Healing Girl
    • Age: 16 (at the time of appearance)
    • Birthday: March 14
    • Blood Type: O
    • Quote: “It’s so fun to be with everyone.”
    • Description: Reserved and quiet, she has trouble expressing her own opinions. Gentle and warm-hearted. With a cute, girly demeanor, her friends often dote on her. Talented in art, she dreams of attending an art university. Though she is taking lessons from the art club teacher, she’s unsure if she should also attend prep school. Meeting Shizuku sparks a change in something within her.
  • Shizuku Kujyo (voiced by Yuki Takada)
    • Catch: Cool and Beautiful Girl
    • Age: 16 (at the time of appearance)
    • Birthday: June 25
    • Blood Type: B
    • Quote: “…I’m not good at this kind of thing, but if it’s with Marin, then… fine.”
    • Description: Perceived as cool and intelligent, but struggles with expressing her emotions, which leads to that impression. Determined and diligent, she approaches tasks with seriousness and dedication. Though she has no fixed plans for her future, she aims to live independently through hard work. After transferring, she harbors complex feelings toward Marin, whom she has just met yet feels strangely familiar. Usually calm and composed, her emotions become more intense when it comes to Marin.
  • Mashiro Saotome (voiced by Yuki Kuwahara)
    • Catch: Bright and Cheerful Mood-Maker
    • Age: 17 (at the time of appearance)
    • Birthday: October 31
    • Blood Type: AB
    • Quote: “Let’s all go karaoke! Kiyo-chi, you’re coming too, no excuses!”
    • Description: Always positive and a cheerful mood-maker. Her mere presence energizes those around her. A nurturing type who can’t leave those in need or distress alone. Dreams of attending a fashion vocational school after high school but worries about balancing family responsibilities. Became fast friends with Marin in high school. Mashiro describes Marin as a “delicate beauty who awakens my protective instincts.”
  • Kiyoka Jinguji (voiced by Noriko Shibasaki)
    • Catch: Caring Older Sister Type
    • Age: 17 (at the time of appearance)
    • Birthday: April 2
    • Blood Type: A
    • Quote: “It’s violin practice day, so I’m heading home now.”
    • Description: A natural leader who excels academically and athletically. With her broad perspective, she often appears wise beyond her years. Though she seems strict, her endearing traits, like a fear of bugs or ghosts, occasionally surface. Loves music and dreams of becoming a composer, though her parents oppose the idea. Determined to convince them, she works hard to achieve her goal. Childhood friends with Mashiro, whom she views as a younger sister and has always protected. Admired as an older-sister figure, though she isn’t fully aware of it.

Dynamic Character Expressions System

Express characters’ emotions in greater variety!

Enhance immersion!

Staff

  • Team Members
    • Project and Concept: vividX
    • Character Design and Original Art: Kukiha
    • Scenario: Mao Kahoku
    • Background Art: Wayu Kaneko / Cheeser
    • Design: Yunoki Hanamori
    • Music: Shoichiro Toko
  • Theme Song
    • Title: “Clover Reset”
    • Music, Lyrics, Arrangement: Shoichiro Toko
    • Vocals: Saho Shirasuna (as Marin Tachibana)
